author: nashatyrev
content:
Hey channel! 
Gossip 1.1 has `flood publish` option which is handy to push own validator attestations and blocks for better propagation time. 

However inbound attestations are not propagated via regular Gossip mechanism but aggregated and also published as outbound. The `flood publish` option though can only be enabled globally and there is no ways to publish some messages with 'flood' option and some messages without 'flood' option

Curious if anyone already hit this limitation and rise any issue/discussion for Libp2p?

author: djrtwo
content:
> However inbound attestations are not propagated via regular Gossip mechanism but aggregated and also published as outbound.
I'm not sure I understand here

author: djrtwo
content: non-aggregated attestations are gossiped in their non-aggregated form through the attestation subnets

author: djrtwo
content: aggregated attestations are then published (and gossiped) on a separate aggregate channel

author: djrtwo
content: I think the "flood publish" should be fine for both of these

author: nashatyrev
content: <@!291925846556540928> Oh, right. Seems like I've lost the track on this topic at some point

author: djrtwo
content:
all good! 
I was just looking at the flood publish option the other day. I think in general that we should use it across the board on our topics

author: nashatyrev
content: Yes, we were discussing this option in Teku team. For some reason I thought that non-aggregated attestations are not propagated immediately by peers (right after validation) and the 'flood publish' option needs to be adjusted. But it looks now like good thing to go.

author: djrtwo
content:
On your end, I would enable the option for now
For that and all of the other gossipsub v1.1 params (especially scoring params), we'll release spec configuration in the next month. We need to run some similuations with our expected network load to tune the scoring params first
